definitions.definition: A conduit made of pipes used to convey water , gas or petroleum , etc.
examples: An oil pipeline has been opened from the Caspian Sea.

definitions.definition: A channel (either physical or logical ) by which information is transmitted sequentially (that is, the first information in is the first information out).
examples: 3D images are rendered using the graphics pipeline .

definitions.definition: A system or process through which something is conducted .
examples: A new version of the software is in the pipeline , but has not been rolled out.

definitions.definition: A widely observed pattern of development in personal interests , circumstances , or opinions .
examples: Many who grew up in foster homes in the county have fallen victim to the foster-care-to-homelessness pipeline .

definitions.definition: A continuous , contributing source of benefits , talent , or innovation .
The inside of a wave that a surfer is riding, when the wave has started closing over it.

main_definition: A conduit made of pipes used to convey water , gas or petroleum , etc.
secondary_definitions: A channel (either physical or logical ) by which information is transmitted sequentially (that is, the first information in is the first information out).
( figurative ) A system or process through which something is conducted .
( figurative ) A widely observed pattern of development in personal interests , circumstances , or opinions .
( figuratively ) A continuous , contributing source of benefits , talent , or innovation .
( surfing ) The inside of a wave that a surfer is riding, when the wave has started closing over it.
